website_summaries.verdict: One of the few wheel chocks you can buy for longer, tandem-wheeled vehicles such as trailers.
pros: Specifically designed for trailers that have tandem wheels lined up in a row
Makes it easier to secure trailers from accidentally rolling away on hills and other uneven surfaces
cons: Wheel chocks can skid on wet terrain

customer_reviews.title: Ordered and received this product for my 39 foot 5th ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received this product for my 39 foot 5th wheel that has leaf spring tandem axles. It didn't work. Called the manufacturer (Camco), and they say it won't work on leaf spring suspensions.(which is 98% of most trailers). They say it will ONLY WORK on TORSION TYPE suspension. ***Wish they would have mentioned that in the product description.****
customer_reviews.author: Michael K.

customer_reviews.title: It does not work with on trailers with tandem axle leaf spring suspension.
customer_reviews.text: Manufacturer does not specify in their product description that this item will not work with tandem axles that have leaf spring suspension. We wasted our money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Noreladim

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but doesn't work on all trailers
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but doesn't work for me..... I bought this for my trailer to carry around in case I ever got a flat several months ago. Now, months after I bought it and well after the return period The tred on one of my tires was off and it really needed to be replaced, so instead of hauling the whole trailer in to replace one tire I decided to use this to remove the one tire. Well..... I pulled it up on the ramp and it was still not high enough.... guess this is worthless for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Wilkinson Power

customer_reviews.title: "Plus" provides the extra lift needed for my RV
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed a friend's Trailer-Aid to change the tire on my camper. The original model doesn't lift the camper high enough to get the bad wheel off the ground, so I had to use a 2x6 under it to get the clearance. I ordered the "Plus" model, and the tire clears without the extra lift. I have 18" wheels on my camper with independent leaf spring suspension. The product does make lifting the trailer for tire change a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: LAB

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work For Leaf-spring, Tandem-axle Fifth-Wheel
customer_reviews.text: With leaf-spring suspension for axles, Trailer Aid Plus could not get front tire high enough to allow clearance for the flat tire behind it to be removed and replaced with spare. So tried to use plastic stabilizer blocks to raise high enough for clearance and Trailer Aide Plus just shattered. Mind you, my 5th wheel weighed only about 10,000 lbs. that day and had to bear only half that weight. Aid Plus supposedly is rated to handle 15,000 lbs. Fortunately had a bottle jack also to do the job. Great product idea, but "saddle" in ramp too low to get needed clearance with independent suspension.
customer_reviews.author: Wildcatt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Lift Tire Off Ground BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item to be ready for a flat tire in my 16 foot enclosed dual axle car trailer. Well, had my first flat, rolled the trailer on the Trailer-Aid and the flat tire didn't come off the ground far enough to be able to remove it. Luckily I had my 3 ton floor jack for the trip in case I needed to work on the car. I would have been out of luck on the road had it not been for the jack. I tested right after purchasing and it lifted the wheel off the ground. With a 2000 pound sports car in the trailer it didn't work. Now its too late to return for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne Henningsen

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money and wasted time
customer_reviews.text: When we needed it the most, it didn't work. Camco doesn't make it clear that this product won't work on leaf spring tandem axles. Which is a majority of RVs. Wasted money and wasted time. Good thing we had a jack when we were stuck on the side of the road. Now it's garbage. Expected better of Camco.
customer_reviews.author: world traveler

customer_reviews.title: Won't work on all tandem axle trailers
customer_reviews.text: Great idea but won't work on all trailers. The travel height between my axles is too great. When pulling on this, the other axle stays on the ground. I suggest measuring the travel before buying. I have a Coleman 192RDS travel trailer. I may be able to get it to work by adding an additional 4 inches of wood under it.
customer_reviews.author: Hike484ks

customer_reviews.title: N/A
customer_reviews.text: Ordered and received this product for my 26 ft travel trailer that has leaf spring tandem axles. It didn't work. it won't work on leaf spring suspensions.(which is 98% of most trailers). manufacturer said it will ONLY WORK on TORSION TYPE suspension. ***Wish they would have mentioned that in the product description.****
customer_reviews.author: Red eagle

customer_reviews.title: For this reason I would recommend this one over the smaller one
customer_reviews.text: Worked extremely well. A very safe way to raise one tire to enable the other tire to be removed or lubricated. Depending on your tire size it may be necessary to place a 1 x 8 under the device to get the needed clearance in order to lift the other wheel completely off the ground. For this reason I would recommend this one over the smaller one. It made lubricating our travel trailer tires so much easier. No need to use a jack.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Bin

customer_reviews.title: Don't RV without this product - you will be glad to have it for your flats.
customer_reviews.text: Had a flat at an RV park - AAA took an hour to get to the sight and then didn't have a sufficient jack to change the flat. I had a bottle jack, but if you know those - they can be dangerous to use - we had to use it anyways to change the flat. With this device, you simply drive the full tire on and change the flat one. Works great and takes us just a little room to store. Order it!
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Beware too short
customer_reviews.text: Beware too short to lift my 19ft Minnie Winnie trailer. It would not raise the trailer tires high enough to remove a tire. I tried a 1" board under the ramp. The ramp simply slid along the board. The trailer tire never entered the ramp to put pressure on the ramp to stabilize it. I was able to change the tire by using the ramp without the board by slightly raising the back of the trailer using the stabilizer. I modified the ramp by installing a 1/2 inch heavy duty rubber material on the top section of the ramp securing it with screws. I will add a picture to show the ramp modified.
customer_reviews.author: Kaypee

customer_reviews.title: I am thrilled with this
customer_reviews.text: We have a 2016 27’ Airstream, and Airstreams have torsional axles, not leaf springs like most other trailers have. We pulled the trailer onto the (5-1⁄2”)Trailer Aid, and happily had about 2” clearance on the other tire. It is so nice to know if we have a tire issue, we do not have to deal with jacks, blocks, unstable ground. It might also come in handy for sites having E/W slopes up to 5-1⁄2” slope differences.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: If you tandem axe trailer has leaf springs, it may not work on your trailer.
customer_reviews.text: The first time i tried to use it ... it broke and it never lifted the other wheel off the ground. I went to return it to Amazon and it's 3 days past the return window. Any one want a broken one ? How do I contact Camco?
customer_reviews.author: motherx3

customer_reviews.title: But a friend recommended these ramps because it is almost impossible to jack ...
customer_reviews.text: Thankfully we haven't had to use this yet (no flat ties on our camper). But a friend recommended these ramps because it is almost impossible to jack up a camper unless you have a very heavy duty professional jack. He used his with a flat and was able to just drive up on it to lift the camper. Also incredibly cheaper than the ones he recommended that he bought at Camper World. The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars was because we can't sat we used it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Martha Curtis

customer_reviews.title: Worked fine on my 2015 Keystone Cougar TT
customer_reviews.text: Just changed a tire on my Keystone Cougar 26RBI (30' overall), 30" axel to axel, individual leaf springs. I sat the Trailer Aide Plus on a 2x10 on asphalt and easily backed up on it. No slippage and plenty of room to change a tire. Given the amount of weight it takes off the axel, I believe that even if your surface did not allow you to raise the tire enough you could easily use the jack included in your tow vehicle to raise the offending axel enough to change the tire.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Esposito

customer_reviews.title: doesn't work with our trailer.
customer_reviews.text: We have a two axel trailer and the axels are wider apart than most trailers. The distance between the tires (not the axels) is about 17 inches (measured from the inside of one tire to the inside of the other tire). The tires are too far apart to change a tire with this product. When I pulled one tire onto the ramp, the other tire was not far enough off the ground to be able to remove it. However, if your axels are close enough together this product should work just fine. It appears that this is a well made, durable product, just not for my trailer design.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas C. Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but didn't wk for me.
customer_reviews.text: Had a flat tire Saturday morning. No problem had my new trailer aid. This was a joke. This might work well with axles that are bolted to frame of trailer but my trailer has shackles on one side of each leaf spring. Rolled front tire up on trailer aid and back tire was flat and still touching ground. Great idea but doesn't work on all trailers. I hate it BC I want one for each trailer but doesn't work on any of my 6 trailers. Glad I didn't order 6.
customer_reviews.author: Billy J.

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient lift.
customer_reviews.text: This Plus ramp is supposed to lift higher than the standard ramp. On the side of the road, I discover I need 3 more inches of lift than the little bit this Plus ramp offers. This useless ramp is a waste of money and space. Worse it gave me a false feeling that I was prepared and left me stranded.
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave your jack at home! But,...
customer_reviews.text: Don't leave your jack at home just because you bought this Trailer-Aid "Plus" Tandem Tire Changing Ramp if you have a larger tandem axle 5th wheel rv. What is good about the ramp is that it takes a lot of weight off the jack when changing the tire or when you need to work on your annual greasing which makes these procedures safer. I recommend this product for part-time and full-time RV'ers. Weekend warriors, save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase (when you need it
customer_reviews.text: Great purchase (when you need it, you really need it). Used once for replacing wheel on 7x16 tandem axle trailer at gas station and several times in driveway for nail in tires. Four steel bolt heads underneath grab the concrete well. Would be nice if it had a taller lip on the front so you don't drive over it completely (fairly exciting but not a big deal, no damage)- Hard to tell by feel when the tire is in the cradle and it's hard to judge visually 20' behind me on the 2nd axle. All in all, well made, light weight and handy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: life saver
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my horse trailer for the road emergency when you have a flat tire and a load of horses. Makes changing a tire a lot easier.
customer_reviews.author: Janet R.

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy!  Won't lift camper!  Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Giant piece of crap. Will not lift camper high enough to get tires off. And now I'm stuck with it. Did not have the opportunity to use immediately. And Amazon won't return it after 30 days. I'm writing this on the 37th day. Doesn't pay to shop ahead.....
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Swafford

customer_reviews.title: Jack it up easy
customer_reviews.text: There are many jack it back jacks out there , But this one is mine :<) Well made & the price is decent. After having two blow outs on the road & having one of the other multi use jacks break up, I had to resort to truck jack to deal with it. No Fun... This thing is well made
customer_reviews.author: the Beerman

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised on my torsion axles
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this for an actual flat tire (thank goodness), but I did test it and it raised my tire enough to change it. I haven't tried it on pavement, I tried it on grass, but it worked as advertised. My trailer is a 2014 Rockwood Roo 21ss and it has torsion axles. I heard this doesn't work well on leaf spring axles, so if you have those, I'd try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Ted S.

customer_reviews.title: Cool item, it worked for me.
customer_reviews.text: Cool item, I had a blowout on a tandem axle travel trailer, called road service, rather than jacking the trailer up the guy set this item under the ramaining good tire on that side and I drove up on that ramp. It raised the blowout high enough to be changed, bought this ramp as soon as we got home from that trip.
customer_reviews.author: James Gromaski

customer_reviews.title: already used and worked well
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this after having a blow out on our tandem 5th wheel camper. Took us an hour to change the tire on the side of the road. Shortly after receiving we had a blow out on our utility trailer. Took us 15 minutes to change our tire with this! took more time to get the spare off and clean up than it did to change tires :) LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: Alisha C

customer_reviews.title: I bought this after a fellow travel trailer friend told ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after a fellow travel trailer friend told me about it. He had had a few trailer tire blow outs, and with the Trailer-Aid, he was able to change the tires quickly and effectively. Although I have not had to use it quite yet (and I hope I never have to use it), I have it in my arsenal of tools to make the job go smoother. The right tool for the job.
customer_reviews.author: BoMan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for changing tires on dual axle RV
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for changing a tire on a dual axle RV trailer quickly and without worrying about Jack points on the trailer. Just pull the non flat tire up onto the ramp and the flat tire lights nicely off the ground. More stable than many Jacks!
customer_reviews.author: Chuck

customer_reviews.title: Used it !
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for the trip to Alaska from Eastern PA. Had one blow out on the Alaskan highway in the Yukon. Just put it in front of the good wheel and up the trailer came. I was a little uneasy as I couldn't see the wheel, but could tell when the trailer settled in the right spot. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Kenyon

customer_reviews.title: Works, sorta.
customer_reviews.text: Well, it doesn't lift my 2009 Keystone Copper Canyon as high as I'd like, but it does help. I'm not returning it due to its high quality and how helpful it is when I use another jack to finish the job. Just be aware it might not completely do what you expect depending on your trailer setup as others have said.
customer_reviews.author: Hobby Hubby

customer_reviews.title: Must have for boat owners!
customer_reviews.text: This was critical for changing tires on our boat trailer. The 4.5" gave us plenty of space to work with, and it's sturdy and simple to use. Only word of advice is to be careful of the spikes when carrying, which are much needed for proper function.
customer_reviews.author: KLcustomer

customer_reviews.title: Gets you back on the road stress free
customer_reviews.text: Great item, heavy duty plastic, finger holes for easy carry, small enough to store, great price. very handy and easy to use with no stress when you’re stressed enough having to change a flat. Gets you back on the road quickly! Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.author: Skipper

customer_reviews.title: Read this first
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and very sturdy. It doesn't raise your car or vehicle as much as you may think though. It will be just enough to get under it and do the necessary work. You will not be able to wheel your whole body under.
customer_reviews.author: MFranks

customer_reviews.title: Only worked for rear tires
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the trailer aid plus (TAP) for my 29ft travel trailer. I tested the TAP at home to be sure it worked for my set up. Moving the trailer on and off the TAP was no problem. The TAP works well if a rear tire needs changing. However if a front tire needs changing, the lift is insufficient. I was able to raise the front tire off the ground using my tongue jack to get a little extra lift. If you purchase this item, I highly recommend you test it before hitting the road. I may return this item, as it does not work as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: BobG

customer_reviews.title: Not what I had hoped for
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would replace the need to carry a carjack. I still had to use blocks under neath it to raise it high enough to get trailer tire off the ground. Biggest issue was that it’s too narrow & the sides of tire doesn’t look healthy hanging over the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Mcbride

customer_reviews.title: It worked amazing! Had a blowout on a major highway in ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this trailer ramp because I was along with a friend and had a blowout on horse trailer. It worked amazing! Had a blowout on a major highway in 95 degree weather, with three horses loaded in the trailer. Changed to the spare tire in about 15 minutes and back on our way!! We went to a tire shop nearby to replace the tire and the tire shop used our Trailer Aid to change to the new tire too! They were impressed with it also!
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Griese

customer_reviews.title: Works well!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after seeing it used on LessJunkMoreJourney on Youtube. It worked great for changing out tires on our tandem axle trailer. Works best on level ground, will raise your tire just enough to remove it. It doesn't slide either when you are positioning your tire. Every trailer should carry one of these. Lightweight but sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: dlms

customer_reviews.title: Great idea!
customer_reviews.text: I've only had to use this once so far, and am totally grateful for the person who came up with this design. Built with heavy duty materials and the sturdiness gives me peace of mind. AND, it's perfect for my horse trailer!
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Did not lift the tire high enough
customer_reviews.text: used as directed. Needed to change a tire on my travel trailer. Backed the tire on one axle on top of the changing ramp. This did not bring the tire on the other axle off of the ground. Not much use to me.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for a 2017 Coachmen Freedom Express 246RKS Tandem Axle
customer_reviews.text: I was hopeful this product would work. Took it out the same day I received it, it is super easy to drive up on. However on my tandem axle trailer it did not lift the back wheel off the ground at all. Returned the same day I bought it. My guess is, it doesn’t work on the newer tandem axle trailers.
customer_reviews.author: Craig E. Jaqua

customer_reviews.title: Compact does not take up alot storage space
customer_reviews.text: Have not had to use this product yet. Bought to use with my 5th wheel travel trailer. It looks well built/sturdy, it’s compact so it doesn’t take up a lot of room in my storage. I hope I don’t have to ever use it (I have had to change tires on the side of the interstate-not fun) but I will be prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not lift tire high enough.
customer_reviews.text: Even with the added section on top, this does not raise the tire up off the ground. We had to put other wood underneath it to get it to work. The corner of it cracked a quick easily also.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Van Den Berg

customer_reviews.title: Don’t leave home without one of these!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a must if you have a tandem trailer. Sooooo easy to use, don’t mess with a jack on the side of the road. This will cut your time by more then half soooo it it way safer due to less time next to busy road.
customer_reviews.author: Meredith Andrea Luce

customer_reviews.title: Tested on a 2017 Rockwood Roo 21dk
customer_reviews.text: Works for a 2017 Rockwood Roo 21dk. I wasn't sure if I needed the standard or the plus. I started with the standard model and it works. I get about 1-1.5 inches of lift. The dip at the top of the ramp is enough where I got the trailer positioned without a spotter. Great product! I like this over a jack.
customer_reviews.author: Chambo

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This thing works so good, it's scared my RV into submission! We've owned our RV for 18 months now and haven't had ANY blowouts! Great "backup" insurance plan if you do have to deal with a blowout on the highway. Mine's been neatly tucked away in the belly "just in case".
customer_reviews.author: TX Geek

customer_reviews.title: Well designed product for tandem axel RV
customer_reviews.text: The Trailer-Aid worked great on a recent blow out we experienced on our tandem axel 34' 5th Wheel Rv. Not only did it make quick work of getting the rim and shredded tire lifted to the necessary height, I felt safer not having to crawl under the trailer on the road's narrow shoulder to position and raise a bottle jack. I was so impressed, I am ordering a second so that I can pull two wheels at once when doing bearing maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Tim D.

customer_reviews.title: Unit arrived damaged
customer_reviews.text: Unit arrived damaged, I assume that it was from shipping, the damaged corner didn't affect the use and I needed it for a road trip so I kept it. If I had to do it over again I would have gone with a better quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: Russ Rhoda

customer_reviews.title: If you have a trailer with dual axles, you need this
customer_reviews.text: Did you ever have to change a trailer tire by jacking up the entire trailer and load? I have. This device makes it so much easier. You will have to have a guide to make sure you don't overshoot the ramp, but that is a minor consideration compared to jacking the trailer up.
customer_reviews.author: MikenTexas

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, works great
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to grease the tandem hubs on our Lance trailer. We double checked that it had Lance had the required torsion bar suspension. Very happy to save money and time on service. I would recommend the Plus over the regular Tire-Aid.
customer_reviews.author: J. Crosby

customer_reviews.title: A gotta Have Item
customer_reviews.text: This item saved my so much trouble, as shortly having bought it, I had a flat on my dual axle horse trailer. It was easy to use, and a have to in traveling to and from with the horse trailer. It is well made with a great competitive price.
customer_reviews.author: classic68

customer_reviews.title: Trailer Aid PLUS Tandem Tire Changing Ramp
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used mine yet, and when I do it'll because I have a D***M FLAT! I've used one like it before and they're great. Way easier than a floor jack and it's obviously quite portable too. I will haul it between my trailers to use on two dual-axle trailers I own. One is a dual axle Heavy Duty boat trailer and the other is a dual axle HD enclosed car/motorcycle trailer. I just move it from trailer to trailer when I use them. Price was the fairest here but all competitors prices were within a couple dollars. Fast shipping & handling...I would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: Oregon Born Ken

customer_reviews.title: A very simple and effective way to lift one tire ...
customer_reviews.text: A very simple and effective way to lift one tire of a tandem pair off the ground. I took the advice of others and got the taller unit for a few dollars more. On soft ground it helps to get the tire high enough to be sure the other clears the ground. I grease my bearings twice a year and this makes what used to be a chore, a simple afternoon job. If I ever have the dreaded blow-out or flat I'm sure this will get me back on the road quicker and safer than any jack.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Five Gold Stars
customer_reviews.text: On the road 30 days. Now camping in a quiet Maine spot. Checked tires' psi as we are headed home. One flat, called locals, no show (but they promised), wasted time waiting for no shows - GADS. Where do you turn? Trailer Aid bought before trip. Wife had said "you can't get it". But I did, she was gracious about my naughty. I'm older with arthritis, could I handle it? Happy ending. Easy to use, follow directions. Then $20 repair at tire store gets us "Five Gold Stars".
customer_reviews.author: Bidwell

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: The easiest way to get your camper in the air to change a tire. Even with tire coverage we have been places out west where response times were hours to get to you. This can be used in a parking lot or anywhere with room to safely change your tire.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Not enough hight
customer_reviews.text: Does not provide enough lift the dual actual high enough ST 205 75 14. On our travel trailer in needed to apply about 1.5 more inches on lift utilizing the stabilizer jack closest the the tire needing changed. The ground was completely flat, concrete and the tires were at spec. I bit disappointed and am contemplating returning this unless someone has some suggestion to make this work better.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C.

customer_reviews.title: Not for heavy boat trailers.
customer_reviews.text: I'm keeping it for possibly another use, but this would not raise the tire on an '02 Myco tandem axle trailer (35' Fountain Lightning). It just does not have the height needed to get the tire off the ground. It is, however, built well for it's purpose, but it's advertised to address trailer flats - and it probably does well on a small enclosed or flat bed trailer - but not a heavy boat trailer.
customer_reviews.author: TM

customer_reviews.title: If you buy it, need to try it before you need use it!  Do not buy if your trailer has springs!
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on 3 different trailers. 2 trailers with no springs like boat trailer dual axle. 3rd trailer travel camping trailer with springs. Boat trailer still did not give me enough lift for new or spare tire. Camper's if you have any kind of spring or suspension plus don't buy it is a waist of time and money. You will find that on a spring suspension it will push your good tire into the well when you drive your good tire up on the Trailer Aid Plus!!!! Manufacture of the product description does not specify of what type of trailer you can use it on.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn Meyer

customer_reviews.title: Just a little too low
customer_reviews.text: I like the item, but the height of the ramp is just a little too low to make tire removal easy. The one and only time I used it, I was lucky enough to be able to dig out a little under the flat tire to get it off after lifting. It might work better for your application, but it is imperfect for mine. It's good to have and simple. If I need to use it again, I will use my truck bottle jack in order to get the tire lifted the additional 3/4" required for easy removal (my tire size is 225/75R 15).
customer_reviews.author: FJR

customer_reviews.title: Ramp might not be tall enough to raise tire off the ground
customer_reviews.text: Very well made product that is easy to use as advertised. However, it not tall enough to raise the tire that need to be changed off the ground. I had to change the front tire on my twin axel 30 foot travel trailer. When I back onto the ramp the front tire was still in contact with the ground preventing removal. I had to add two 2 X 6 )boards (4 inches) under the ramp to get the tire off the ground so I could remove it. If you purchase this product be sure to test at home before taking it on the road to make sure it will work on your trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Bearpass

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but didn't work for me on concrete
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used this it shot out from under the wheel. The concrete was fairly smooth in the garage but I expected the teeth and bots to do their job. I ended up using a bottle jack. The bottle jack is easier to store too!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: EVERY trailer should have one!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used it the week it arrived. Makes horse trailer blow outs easy to deal with, without having to unload animals on the side of the highway. Tire changed to spare in less than 20 minutes. May opt for the larger model, but this one works great for even my large trailer. 100% Solid recommendation!!! 👍👍
customer_reviews.author: CayDay

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Easier to carry with you and much lighter than a typical floor jack. Used it once and it worked very well. My only suggestion for improvement is to make it slightly wider. My trailer tire rode up, stayed in the cradle, and there was no slippage, but the entire width of the tire's contact patch was not completely supported; there was a just a little of the tire's tread edge that hung over the sides (I'm using the trailer tires that came from the trailer manufacturer, not oversize tires). Even so, I would highly recommend this product, and would not hesitate to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Clinton Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: Complete waste of money...or a really expensive wheel chock. I have a 2012 cherokee grey wolf 28bhs. Back onto trailer aid and the front tire of tandem set just lowered. Put four planks under unit adding another 3 inches. I think my units has a suspension that adjust tires, because front set was firmly on ground with like 7+ inches of lift. Used my ford truck jack (2103 f150) with rr tie piece on frame just in front of bad tire and was so easy. Regretting this purchase and while seemingly good idea, the jack with your tow vehicle probably fine.
customer_reviews.author: S. Funston

customer_reviews.title: So glad I had it handy
customer_reviews.text: First trip since my purchase and I had to use it. So glad I had it handy. I blew out a tire on a busy interstate (holiday traffic) and had no choice but to change the tire on the shoulder with cars whizzing by at 70+ MPH. Nerve-wracking and dangerous to say the least. Backed my good tire (back tire) onto ramp and changed out the bad (front) tire and was safely underway in less than 10 minutes. Was very happy to have made this purchase and I will not leave home with my trailer hitched up without it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I don't use it for the intended purpose. Still works great!
customer_reviews.text: I use these to change the oil on my Nissan Versa. I bought two and use them to lift my car high enough off the ground that I can get under it. It does the job with no fear of slipping. My one issue is that the cradle which holds the tire is a bit narrow and I found myself driving all the way over it and having to try again when getting my car up on the thing. Other than that it works great though.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Hill

customer_reviews.title: Not quite enough
customer_reviews.text: Got the trailer aid to swap out the tires on my 25' travel trailer. The trailer has 14" wheels and the trailer aid did not have enough lift to get the other tire off the ground. Fortunately I had managed to find a 2x8 kicking around the storage area and this in addition to the trailer aid provided enough lift. I tried to use my leveling blocks but they would slip and make the lifting situation hazardous trying to get the trailer lifted. worked quite well with the 2x8 that is the ONLY reason it got 3 stars. If I would not found the 2x8 only one star and a angry amazon shopper.
customer_reviews.author: PPC123

customer_reviews.title: Works just like it's supposed to so far.
customer_reviews.text: I have only ran a trial run in the parking lot with my RV but it worked great there.Because of the weight of my trailer it was hard to tell when I got to the place to stop and so I had to try a couple of times but once it was located where it was supposed to be it gave enough clearance to remove and replace the wheel on the other axle. Much easier that jacking the trailer up. It is sturdy enough to hold the trailer but light enough to move around and store with ease.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle White

customer_reviews.title: You need this!
customer_reviews.text: Every RVer should have one! End of story. We replaced all four tires you would not believe companies that sell tires would not let RV’s on their property. I ordered online was very happy how was it was to trade out tired
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tire Changing Ramp
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Trailer-Aid Tire Changing Ramp before and they are essential for RVers with tandem/multiple axle trailers. No need to attempt to jack or raise a 5th wheel or TT, just place under the good tire and push or pull the RV into position on the ramp cradle and change the flat tire. Nothing could be easier or quicker.
customer_reviews.author: htg1969

customer_reviews.title: Not enough lift for my 5er.
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for my trailer but that doesn't mean it won't lift others. Drove mine up on the block and the other wheel still sat plainly on the ground. Guess my suspension has a lot of flex. Kind of a hit or miss as it is advertised as working but obviously it doesn't in all cases. Will keep it because I can still use it to level my trailer and most importantly, I tossed the box. Best suggestion is to find someone who has one and try it before you buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott K.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, test it before hitting the road
customer_reviews.text: This makes tire changes so much easier and I consider it a must have. Make sure to test it out with a fully loaded trailer before hitting the road, I sure am glad we did! It worked perfectly to service our double axle boat trailer while the boat was still in the water but once we loaded the boat it would no longer lift the tire off the ground and required a couple treated 2×8s underneath it to get enough lift to raise the tires off the ground. So much easier than the floor jack I used to take with us on trips
customer_reviews.author: Papa Bear

customer_reviews.title: Easy tire change
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. drive up on it with the good tire and it lifts the old tire off the ground for easy changing. Love the concept and the way it does as described .
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Product Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: It does get the good tire up so the flat tire is off the ground for removal. I like this product for my RV camper, but take a 3 ton jack as a secondary method. Product will last for many many years.
customer_reviews.author: TeamLentz

customer_reviews.title: A bit expensive but a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 26' tandem axle 10K enclosed race trailer. I've had 3 tire failures in the past couple years. When I'm on the road by myself, while I can certainly jack the trailer up with no problem, this makes it way faster and easier. Plus, it's very helpful to work underneath the trailer at home. I think it's priced a little high considering what it is, but I'm still happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: wh

customer_reviews.title: Highly recomended
customer_reviews.text: I've used the product to remove wheels and it works great. It can also be used as a leveling device in a pinch. I'd buy the product again. Well designed, seems durable. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Just a guy

customer_reviews.title: Have not used it yet, but will be able ...
customer_reviews.text: Have not used it yet, but will be able to change a tire on the roadside now. Before I got this, I had the spare tire, I had the wrench set, but I had no way to elevate it. Met someone who popped a tire on their first RV trip and had to call a shop to come out and change it. If you have dual axles, this will get the popped tire off the ground to change it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: must have
customer_reviews.text: just as described, arrived on time, will buy again from seller, lol bought after I needed it, will make the next flat easier to take care of
customer_reviews.author: dan

customer_reviews.title: Probably Won’t Work!
customer_reviews.text: When it doesn’t lift your tire up enough to get it off the ground then what’s the point. I kept because it sometimes raises one side of the trailer enough to level it for an overnight stay. Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: "bisonwings"

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stay in place.
customer_reviews.text: Seemed like a good idea, but after receiving and trying, it didn't work for me. I couldn't stop it from sliding. I even put a piece of rubber under it and it still would not stay in place long enough for the wheel to roll upon it. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Red Johnson

customer_reviews.title: It didn’t work for my 24’ travel trailer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased for my 24’ prime time air 230. I put in my trailer and I didn’t use it for 18 months. When it came time to lube my wheel bearing I thought it be perfect. Wrong guess, the rear tire never got off the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Old Retired Chief, USN

customer_reviews.title: Not high enough
customer_reviews.text: Built nice but wouldnt get my tire off the ground to change. I have 2013 outback with a pivoting duel axle so when the full tire went up the flat pivoted back to the ground denying me the ability to remove the flat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does not work !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my RV travel trailer if I had tire trouble. Tried to see if it would work to make sure I was able to change flat tire. I found out it does not raise the other tire in front or rear high enough to remove the other tire. This will not work on my RV. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Deramax

customer_reviews.title: Need a safe space to maneuver, super easy to use, not much required.
customer_reviews.text: So glad we had this on our trip. So much easier and felt much safer to use than a jack. We were fortunate in that we had a safe space to maneuver at the rest stop where we discovered our tire needed replacing.
customer_reviews.author: T&CB.

customer_reviews.title: Frustration-free tire change!
customer_reviews.text: On the first day of our month-long vacation, we had a flat on our travel trailer. It took me over an hour to do a simple tire change using the (basically) worthless jack for our truck. Right away I started looking for an easier solution, and purchased the Trailer-Aid based on the reviews. Lo and behold, we had a blowout on the second day of our trip home. The Trailer-Aid worked slicker than snot; it raised the flat tire enough to remove it and still had enough clearance to mount the inflated spare. Total time for the tire change was under 15 minutes. It definitely paid for itself already. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Don Varga

customer_reviews.title: Isn't made for all tandem axles.
customer_reviews.text: Had to experiment with it and found it didn't grip very well on asphalt surfaces. Also, on our trailer, the axles are connected independently to each other, meaning they do not go up, or down together. I had to place leveling blocks (9) underneath the the ramp and drive the good tire up onto it.This enabled the "blown" tire to get high enough off the ground to turn freely.
customer_reviews.author: Chevy Fan

customer_reviews.title: May not be good for all tandem trailers
customer_reviews.text: Best if you have torsion style springs on your tandem axles. Shackled axles, especially ones with slippers, allow the wheel with the flat tire to drop down as the ramped wheel is raised. There may not be enough lift to get the flat tire up and off of the ground using this device alone. You might want to research further.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Ruark

customer_reviews.title: I would be nice if the ramp was about one or two inches ...
customer_reviews.text: This ramp worked well--installed four new brake sets on a 32 foot 5th wheel trailer by using this. No need to position a floor jack under the axle, etc. I did have to place a one inch thick board under the ramp so that the lifted tire would clear the ground. I would be nice if the ramp was about one or two inches taller.
customer_reviews.author: C. Stickley

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Have not had to use it (and hopefully won't) but it's solid and will absolutely do the job on my tandem axle trailer. A must have item imo.
customer_reviews.author: Scott T

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t lift my tandem axle boat trailer tire off the ground!
customer_reviews.author: Landen T.

customer_reviews.title: Must have for horse trailers.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product before and it’s great. Resist the temptation to park your trailer using this to prop your jack wheel, it doesn’t last as long if kept outside.
customer_reviews.author: laurahow

customer_reviews.title: A must for tandem axle trailer owners
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised- a real gem for changing a tandem axle boat trailer tire!! I would measure the clearance from axle to ground before ordering and I used a piece of 1X6 pressure treated wood (2' long) to stabilize- probably did not need the wood...but it takes up no room and in case I'm ever on a soft shoulder doing this- I'll be glad I had it
customer_reviews.author: CSpell

customer_reviews.title: looks solid
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had to use (yet), but it looks like it will do the trick. I got a flat the first day I was travelling with my trailer, came out in the morning and it was flat, but luckily it was tandem, empty, and 200 yds from a tire shop so I was able to get it fixed. It got me thinking about what I would have done had that not been the case. Lifting a 7500 lb trailer is not my idea of fun and a normal floor jack won't handle that weight of reach. definitely go with the 'Plus' model, because I doubt it would clear the ground without the extra inch added to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: Great tool for propping up a double axle trailer. Makes it easy to change a tire without a jack. Do it on a solid surface.
customer_reviews.author: BW

customer_reviews.title: Good to have on hand!
customer_reviews.text: Worked as describes, ideally I should have gone for the "plus" version, I think the extra height would have made things more smoother. Successfully changed my travel tires with this!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: In case of emergency
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for the time i might need to change a tire. Had a time years ago where i needed one and didn't have it so felt this was needed.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin T

customer_reviews.title: Must have!
customer_reviews.text: Does what it was designed for in a quick/emergency tire change. They are still pretty proud of this ramp and hopefully price comes down for others. I have bought a pair of 8000lbs ramps for my truck for have what I paid for this one ramp. A must have though, if your traveling with an expensive boat or camper.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Steve

customer_reviews.title: Wheels up
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 24' enclosed car trailer as well as my aluminum car trailer. Good quality item and looks sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: Does not work on leaf spring trailers.
customer_reviews.text: Does not work on leaf spring trailers, other axle simply drops. at best you'll have to jack less, but if you have to pull out a jack what's the point.
customer_reviews.author: greg kennedy

customer_reviews.title: The Trailer Aid Plus Tandem Tire Changing Ramp
customer_reviews.text: I jacked up one tire on my Fifth-wheel trailer to see how high it had to go before the other wheel came off the ground. This ramp has about an inch to spare! Check yours before you buy. The ramp itself is great. It is very heavy duty, light weight, and the newer ones have a modification to address the problem some people had of it slipping on pavement, while trying to pull up on it. They have added steel bolts near the lip that dig in to pavement and hold it still. This is the thing to have when you are out on the road!
customer_reviews.author: 5-strang

product_meta.title: Trailer-Aid "Plus" Tandem Tire Changing Ramp, The Fast and Easy Way To Change A Trailer's Flat Tire, Holds up to 15,000 Pounds, 5.5 Inch Lift (Yellow)
product_meta.description:
Color:Yellow| Style:Trailer Aid PlusTrailer Aid Plus is the fast, safe and easy way to change a trailer tire on a tandem wheeled trailer. You pull the good tire up onto Trailer Aid Plus to raise the flat tire up 5.5" for changing. Trailer Aid Plus has an additional 1" lift more than the original Trailer Aid and is perfect for RV trailers and horse trailers. It is great for horse trailers so you do not have to remove your horses in order to change a flat tire. The extra 1" lift is handy when performing routine maintenance on the trailer. Lifetime guarantee.

AMAZON.COM


CHANGE A FLAT TIRE ANYWHERE, ANYTIME-WITHOUT HELP
Trailer-Aid and Trailer-Aid Plus offer a fast, safe and easy way to change a trailer’s flat tire. A flat tire never happens at a good time, usually when you are by yourself on a busy highway. Trailer-Aid and Trailer-Aid Plus allows anyone to change a flat tire anywhere, anytime—without help, without a jack and without unloading.

Step-by-step use instructions. 
View larger. TRAILER-AID
Trailer-Aid can withstand weights up to 15,000 lbs, and is waterproof and rustproof. Made from lightweight super strong polymer, Trailer-Aid is easy to travel with and makes changing your trailer tire simple, even if you're alone. The front holes and rear slot allow for easy handling and access. Small and lightweight (only 5 lbs), Trailer-Aid stores easily and unobtrusively. It is light enough to be carried on the finger tips, and has clean edges that won’t snag clothing or hurt hands. It offers 4-1/2” of lift giving you the clearance you need to get the job done.

TRAILER-AID PLUS
Trailer-Aid Plus offers all the same benefits as the Trailer Aid but is engineered specifically for recreational trailers. It gives your tire 5-1/2” of lift, an extra 1" more than Trailer-Aid, for performing maintenance on brakes, wheels and axles.

ABOUT CAMCO MANUFACTURING
Camco started in 1966 with one employee and one product. Today, over 40 years later, we have more than 350 employees, over 3,000 products and five manufacturing facilities to better serve our customers’ needs. Our home office is in Greensboro, North Carolina. We also have locations in Elkhart, Indiana; Portland, Oregon; Leominster, Massachusetts and our newest facility in Beilun, China.

Competitive pricing, superior service, quality products and customer satisfaction are the foundations upon which Camco operates. Our friendly, knowledgeable customer service staff stands ready to assist our customers with any questions. At Camco, we take pride in meeting the ever changing demands of a challenging marketplace while serving you, our most valuable asset.
feature_bullets: Easily change flat tire on tandem wheel trailer
Allows you to keep cargo in trailer while changing tire
Simply drive the good tire up onto Trailer Aid
5.5" of lift to aid in performing routine maintenance
Made of lightweight super strong polymer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars2,062 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
